member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.UserAPI.logInUser(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.AutoAddUserTypes)
member.summary: Used to force log in the user and no password required. Note: When using Active Directory/LDAP, this method will log the user only after first successfull LDAP/AD User Login into CMS. when using Active Directory, the ServerName and Protocol parameters are set to empty strings ("").
member.param: The system server name. When using Active Directory, this parameter needs to be an empty string "".
The user's domain, required only when users login using Active Directory. If your domain is intra.example.com, it is entered in the following format: "DC=intra,DC=example,DC=com".
Required only when using a secure login or when you are using any valid Active Directory protocols.
member.remarks: Using this method may increase security risk

member.summary: Value for the variable.

member.summary: This class used to define custom search conditions to lookup users against users table and dynamic_definition_tbl aka custom properties.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.ContentSearchCondition.setVariable
member.summary: Value for the variable.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.ContentSearchCondition
member.summary: This class is used to define custom search conditions to lookup content against a content object and metadata (custom properties).

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.SearchManager.Execute(Ektron.Cms.UserSearchCondition)
member.summary: Returns the array of UserData based on the criteria UserSearchCondition.

example.code:
Dim isMemberShip As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition isMemberShip.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isMemberShip.setValue = 1 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with db type isMemberShip.setVariable = users.membership_user
Dim isInEktron As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition isInEktron.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isInEktron.setValue = "03031" 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with dynamic_data_tbl labels type isInEktron.setVariable = "customproperties.zip code"
Dim condition As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition condition.setType = SearchType.AND condition.AddCondition(isInEktron) condition.AddCondition(isMemberShip)
Dim search As New SearchManager Dim result As userdata() = search.Execute(condition)

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.SearchManager.Execute(Ektron.Cms.UserSearchCondition,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.Users,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.OrderByDirection)
member.summary: Returns the array of UserData based on the criteria UserSearchCondition and order by column.

example.code:
Dim isMemberShip As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition isMemberShip.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isMemberShip.setValue = 1 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with db type isMemberShip.setVariable = users.membership_user
Dim isInEktron As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition isInEktron.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isInEktron.setValue = "03031" 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with dynamic_data_tbl labels type isInEktron.setVariable = "customproperties.zip code"
Dim condition As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition condition.setType = SearchType.AND condition.AddCondition(isInEktron) condition.AddCondition(isMemberShip)
Dim search As New SearchManager Dim result As userdata() = search.Execute(condition, Ektron.Cms.EkEnumeration.Users.user_name, Ektron.Cms.EkEnumeration.OrderByDirection.Descending )

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.SearchManager.Execute(Ektron.Cms.ContentSearchCondition)
member.summary: Returns the array of ContentData based on the criteria ContentSearchCondition..

example.code:
Dim isContentLanguage As ContentSearchCondition = New ContentSearchCondition isContentLanguage.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isContentLanguage.setValue = 1033 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with db type isContentLanguage.setVariable = content.content_language
Dim isInEktron As ContentSearchCondition = New ContentSearchCondition isInEktron.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isInEktron.setValue = "03031" 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with dynamic_data_tbl labels type isInEktron.setVariable = "customproperties.zip code"
Dim condition As ContentSearchCondition = New ContentSearchCondition condition.setType = SearchType.AND condition.AddCondition(isInEktron) condition.AddCondition(isMemberShip)
Dim search As New SearchManager Dim result As userdata() = search.Execute(condition)

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.SearchManager.Execute(Ektron.Cms.ContentSearchCondition,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.Content,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.OrderByDirection)
member.summary: Returns the array of ContentData based on the criteria ContentSearchCondition and order by column.

example.code:
Dim isContentLanguage As ContentSearchCondition = New ContentSearchCondition isContentLanguage.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isContentLanguage.setValue = 1033 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with db type isContentLanguage.setVariable = content.content_language
Dim isInEktron As ContentSearchCondition = New ContentSearchCondition isInEktron.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isInEktron.setValue = "03031" 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with dynamic_data_tbl labels type isInEktron.setVariable = "customproperties.zip code"
Dim condition As ContentSearchCondition = New ContentSearchCondition condition.setType = SearchType.AND condition.AddCondition(isInEktron) condition.AddCondition(isMemberShip)
Dim search As New SearchManager Dim result As userdata() = search.Execute(condition, Ektron.Cms.EkEnumeration.Users.user_name, Ektron.Cms.EkEnumeration.OrderByDirection.Descending )

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FlexNavigation.StartLevel
member.summary: Enter a number to indicate the level at which you want this menu to display when it first appears. To begin the menu display at the root level, enter zero (0). Note that the StartLevel property is ignored when StartMenuId is not zero.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FlexNavigation.UseAliasRealId
member.summary: If system id using manual aliasing, and the aliased menu item does not get selected due to external link that generates a URL which contains the real path and ID, setting this true will force first matching menu item ID to be selected.
member.remarks: Not normally needed (default: False), but available for special cases when both alias and non-alias references to the same menu item must be allowed.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FlexNavigation.LogInfo
member.summary: Set to true to enable logging verbose info to the event log (such as information on reasons for menu selection), must set web.config LogLevel to verbose.
member.remarks: Used to assist identifying a configuration problem, when the menu does not appear to select what the designer intended.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FlexNavigation.XmlRequired
member.summary: Set to true to force populating XmlDoc, otherwise may be null if markup is found in cache.
member.remarks: For performance reasons, the markup is stored and retrieved from cache - normally negating the need to utilize XML unless the markup is not in the cache. This property allows overriding the default bahavior in order to make use of the XML in custom code.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.FlexNavigation.StartMenuId
member.summary: If only a portion of the menu tree below MenuId is required, set this property to the desired starting menu-ID and only it and it's children will be used to create the XML. Set this to zero to begin with the standard MenuId (default). Note that the StartLevel property is ignored when StartMenuId is not zero.
member.value: The starting menu ID, or zero if MenuId is to be used (default)
member.returns: The starting menu ID, zero if starting with MenuId (default)
member.remarks: Used to allow starting at a submenu instead of a menu-root node (default)

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.StartExportFolderForTranslation(System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Starts the process of exporting all the content specified by ContentType in the specified folder. Optionally, all the content in the subfolders may be processed as well. The status of the process may be monitored by visiting localizationjobs.aspx, which uses methods in this class. The translatable text and documents are exported as XLIFF files compressed in ZIP files. The XLIFF files are suitable for sending to a translator. Once translated, the XLIFF files should be imported using the .
member.param: Specifies the folder containing the content to export.
Specifies which type or types of content to export.
Specifies whether to export just the specified folder or all subfolders as well.
Comma\-delimited list of language IDs. e.g., "1031,1036"
member.remarks:
To export just selected content, use StartExportFolderForTranslation (Integer Integer Boolean String).
See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.StartExportContentForTranslation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Starts the process of exporting the content specified by ListOfContentIDs. The status of the process may be monitored by visiting localizationjobs.aspx, which uses methods in this class. The translatable text and documents are exported as XLIFF files compressed in ZIP files. The XLIFF files are suitable for sending to a translator. Once translated, the XLIFF files should be imported using the method.
member.param: Comma-delimited list of content IDs. e.g., "11,12"
Comma-delimited list of language IDs. e.g., "1031,1036"
member.remarks: To export all content in a folder, use StartExportFolderForTranslation (Integer Integer Boolean String). See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.StartExportMenusForTranslation(System.String)
member.summary: Starts the process of exporting all menus. The status of the process may be monitored by visiting localizationjobs.aspx, which uses methods in this class. The translatable text is exported as an XLIFF file and compressed in a ZIP file. The XLIFF file is suitable for sending to a translator. Once translated, the XLIFF file should be imported using the method.
member.param: Comma-delimited list of language IDs. e.g., "1031,1036"
member.remarks: See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.StartExportTaxonomyForTranslation(System.String)
member.summary: Starts the process of exporting all menus. The status of the process may be monitored by visiting localizationjobs.aspx, which uses methods in this class. The translatable text is exported as an XLIFF file and compressed in a ZIP file. The XLIFF file is suitable for sending to a translator. Once translated, the XLIFF file should be imported using the method.
member.param: Comma-delimited list of language IDs. e.g., "1031,1036"
member.remarks: See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.StartImportTranslation
member.summary: Starts the process of importing XLIFF files that have been translated. The files should be uploaded to server directory specified by . Files may be XLIFF files (.xlf extension) or XLIFF files that are compressed in ZIP (.zip extension) files.
member.remarks: See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.CancelJob(System.Int64)
member.summary: Stops the specified process started by or one of the StartExport*ForTranslation methods.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetTranslationUploadDirectory
member.summary:
Returns the server directory path to upload XLIFF and ZIP files for importing. For example,
C:\\inetpub\\wwwroot\\CMS400Demo\\workarea\\uploadedfiles\\localization.
\See Also: .
member.returns: The server directory path (as a String) to store XLIFF and ZIP files that are to be imported.
member.remarks: This directory path should not be displayed on a web page.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetJobs
member.summary:
Returns a list of the top-level jobs, export and import jobs. The jobs listed depend on the user id, unauthenticated users (e.g., translators) see only publicly available jobs (e.g., ZIP files for download). Administrators can view all jobs, non-administrators may only view jobs they created.
This function is overloaded. See Also: GetJobs (Integer)
member.returns: A data table of top-level jobs.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetJobs(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Returns a list of the sub jobs of the given job.
This function is overloaded. See Also:

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetJobByID(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the specified job.
member.returns: A job record or Nothing if not found.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetFileByID(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the specified file record.
member.returns: A record of a job file or Nothing if not found.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetFilesByJob(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a list of files associated with a given job.
member.remarks: Files are typically ZIP files for export jobs and ZIP and XLIFF files for import jobs.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetFilesInFile(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a list of files in a given ZIP file.
member.remarks: Files are typically ZIP and XLIFF files for import jobs. The export process usually will not generate ZIP files with other ZIP files in them.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetContentItemsByJob(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a list of content items (i.e., XLIFF skeletons) associated with a given job.
member.returns: A data table of content (i.e., skeleton) items.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetInterchangeFilesInFile(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a list of interchange files (i.e., XLIFF files) contained within a given ZIP file.
member.returns: A data table of XLIFF files.
member.remarks: XLIFF is a standard to interchange localization information for translation of text. The XLIFF files are compressed together into one or more ZIP files for convenience.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetInterchangeFilesByContentItem(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a list of interchange files (i.e., XLIFF files) associated with a given content item (i.e., XLIFF Skeleton).
member.param: Specifies the content item (i.e., XLIFF skeleton).
member.returns: A data table of XLIFF files.
member.remarks: When exporting, XLIFF files for each target language are generated from a skeleton. When importing, an XLIFF file is associated with the skeleton content item it was generated from (the original language) and a new skeleton content item generated by merging the XLIFF with the original skeleton to produce a skeleton in the target language. A skeleton consists of the content, typically the main HTML content block, a summary (HTML), title, meta data, etc.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI.GetInterchangeFileByID(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the interchange (i.e., XLIFF) file record specified by ID.
member.param: Specifies the interchange (i.e., XLIFF) file record.
member.returns: A data record of the selected XLIFF file or Nothing if it does not exist.

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.LocalizationAPI

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CustomFieldsApi.GetEditableCustomFieldAssignments(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary:
Returns the editable custom fields.
Break Inheritance checkbox: * Visible if not at root. * Checked if any fields assigned without inheritance. * If unchecked and form saved, removes all assignments. creates NULL assignment (CustomFieldID -1). * When checked, enables all assignment checkboxes (iterate through all of this tables elements). * When unchecked, disables all assignment checkboxes (iterate through all of this tables elements).
* Assignment Checkboxes: * When clicked: if 'Assignment' button -\> going unchecked, then ensure required us unchecked. * When clicked: if 'Required' button, don't accept checks if assigned is unchecked. * When form submitted, copy checked items to hidden field. * Form processor; * If break inheritance checked, and any items in hidden field, send contents to db. * If break inheritance checked, and hidden field empty, create dummy assignment fieldID = -1. * If break inheritance NOT checked, remove all assignments for this folder.
Note: If editMode is false, then items are visible but not changeable by user.
member.remarks: Function GetEditableCustomFieldAssignments: ''

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CustomFieldsApi.AddNewEditableCustomFieldAssignments(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns the HTML string for the add/edit custom fields.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CustomFieldsApi.ProcessCustomFields(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Process Folders' Custom-Field (and metadata) assignments:
When form submitted, copy checked items to hidden field. Form processor: If break inheritance checked, and any items in hidden field, send contents to db. If break inheritance checked, and hidden field empty, create dummy assignment fieldID = -1. If break inheritance NOT checked, remove all assignments for this folder.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CustomFieldsApi.IsFolderBreakingCustFieldinheritance(System.Int64)

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.GetContentById(System.Int64,Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.ContentResultType)
member.summary: Loads the content details using the content ID. Only returns content of type CMSContentType.Content and CMSContentType.Assets.
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source code file:
CMS400Example\\Workarea\\controls\\approval\\addapproval.ascx.vb.
The following is a code snippet from that page.
Private Sub Display_AddApproval() security_data = m_refContentApi.LoadPermissions(m_intId, ItemType) If (ItemType = "folder") Then folder_data = m_refContentApi.GetFolderById(m_intId) Else content_data = m_refContentApi.GetContentById(m_intId) End If Dim approval_data() As ApprovalData approval_data = m_refContentApi.GetAllUnassignedItemApprovals(m_intId, ItemType) AddApprovalToolBar() Populate_AddApprovals(approval_data) End Sub
member.remarks: Read permission required.

member.summary: Function takes in information about the content to be checked in and published. This goes through the normal approval chain. The content must be in a checked out state to the current logged in user for this to succeed.
member.param: Integer value of the content's ID
Integer value of the content folder's ID
Integer value of the content's language ID
If this parameter is "" a task will be created for this submit, else it will not
The user ID of task assigned by (current user). This is needed only if "dontCreateTask" is "", it is ignored else
Title for the task. This is needed only if "dontCreateTask" is "", it is ignored else
member.returns: A Boolean indicating success or not.
member.remarks: User must be logged in and have sufficient privileges to submit content for publishing.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.GetFieldsByFolder(System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the custom fields for the passed in Folder ID as a collection.
member.param: Long, the ID of the folder for which to return the custom fields
Long, the ID of the language for which to return the custom fields (English is 1033)
member.example:
This returns all of the types associated with folder 0. Then, loops through each, setting the temp variables to the values returned for each custom field
Dim content As new ContentAPI(); Dim folderId As Long Dim language As Long Dim longTemp As Long Dim stringTemp As String folderId = 0 language = 1033 Microsoft.VisualBasic.Collection types = EkContent.GetFieldsByFolder(folderId, language); foreach (Microsoft.VisualBasic.Collection tempCol in folderTypes) { longTemp = tempCol("CustomFieldID") 'Long stringTemp = tempCol("CustomFieldName") 'String longTemp = tempCol("Assigned") 'Long longTemp = tempCol("Required") 'Long longTemp = tempCol("OwningFolderID") 'Long }
member.remarks: Must be logged in

member.summary: Retrieves the folder's details.
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source code file:
CMS400Example\\Workarea\\controls\\folder\\movefolderitem.ascx.vb.
The following is a code snippet from that page.
Private Sub InitFolderIsXmlFlags() Dim fldrData As FolderData Dim nFolderID As Integer = 0 fldrData = m_refContentApi.GetFolderById(0) m_rootFolderIsXml = IIf((Not (fldrData.XmlConfiguration Is Nothing)), 1, 0) If (Not (Request.QueryString("id") Is Nothing)) Then nFolderID = Convert.ToInt32(Request.QueryString("id")) End If fldrData = m_refContentApi.GetFolderById(nFolderID) source_folder_is_xml.Value = IIf((Not (fldrData.XmlConfiguration Is Nothing)), 1, 0) End Sub
member.remarks: Read permission required

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.GetAllFormsByFolder(System.Int64,System.String,System.Int32,Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.FormResultType)
member.summary: Retrieves an array of all the forms contained with the specified folder. Forms may be limited to a single language and type.
member.param: Specifies how to sort the forms
Specifies a language or EkConstants.g_AllContentLanguages (-1) for all languages.
Specifies whether only active forms or archived forms should be returned.
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source code file:
CMS400Example\\FormApi.aspx.vb.
The following is a code snippet from that page.
Private Sub ShowFormList() Dim aryFormList As FormData() Dim nFolderId As Integer Dim nLanguageId As Integer nFolderId = txtFolderID.Text nLanguageId = LanguageSelect.LanguageID aryFormList = m_ContentApi.GetAllFormsByFolder(nFolderId, "title", nLanguageId, FormResultType.Form) If Not IsNothing(aryFormList) AndAlso aryFormList.Length > 0 Then lblNumForms.Text = aryFormList.Length dgForm.DataSource = CreateFormDataSource(aryFormList) If Not IsNothing(dgForm.DataSource) Then dgForm.DataBind() End If End If End Sub
member.remarks: Requires authentication.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.GetAssetSupertypes
member.summary: Loads all of the asset supertypes supported by documents add-in.
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source code file:
CMS400Example\\Workarea\\controls\\folder\\viewfolder.ascx.vb.
The following is a code snippet from that page.
Public Function GetAddMultiType() As Long ' gets ID for "add multiple" asset type GetAddMultiType = 0 Dim count As Integer asset_data = m_refContentApi.GetAssetSupertypes() If (Not asset_data Is Nothing) Then For count = 0 To asset_data.Length - 1 If (ManagedAsset_Min <= asset_data(count).TypeId And asset_data(count).TypeId <= ManagedAsset_Max) Then If "*" = asset_data(count).PluginType Then GetAddMultiType = asset_data(count).TypeId End If End If Next End If End Function

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.GetChildFoldersByFolderId(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Loads all the subfolders for a given folder ID.
member.param: True = recursive look up. False = none
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source code file:
CMS400Example\\Workarea\\WorkAreaTrees.aspx.vb.
The following is a code snippet from that page.
' Implement the callback interface Private Function RaiseCallbackEvent() As String Dim result As String = "" Dim folder_arr_data As FolderData() Dim folder_data As FolderData Dim m_intId As Integer If (Request.QueryString("method").ToLower = "get_folder") Then m_intId = Convert.ToInt32(Request.Params.Item("id")) folder_data = m_refContentApi.GetFolderById(m_intId) result = SerializeAsXmlData(folder_data, folder_data.GetType) ElseIf (Request.QueryString("method").ToLower = "get_child_folders") Then m_intId = Convert.ToInt32(Request.Params.Item("folderid")) folder_arr_data = m_refContentApi.GetChildFoldersByFolderId(m_intId) result = SerializeAsXmlData(folder_arr_data, folder_arr_data.GetType) End If Return (result) End Function

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.GetChildFolders(System.Int64,System.Boolean,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.FolderOrderBy)
member.summary: Loads all the subfolders for a given folder ID.
member.param: True = recursive look up. False = none
The field to order the results by
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source code file:
CMS400Example\\Workarea\\WorkAreaTrees.aspx.vb.
The following is a code snippet from that page.
' Implement the callback interface Private Function RaiseCallbackEvent() As String Dim result As String = "" Dim folder_arr_data As FolderData() Dim folder_data As FolderData Dim m_intId As Integer If (Request.QueryString("method").ToLower = "get_folder") Then m_intId = Convert.ToInt32(Request.Params.Item("id")) folder_data = m_refContentApi.GetFolderById(m_intId) result = SerializeAsXmlData(folder_data, folder_data.GetType) ElseIf (Request.QueryString("method").ToLower = "get_child_folders") Then m_intId = Convert.ToInt32(Request.Params.Item("folderid")) folder_arr_data = m_refContentApi.GetChildFoldersByFolderId(m_intId, false, FolderOrderBy.Name) result = SerializeAsXmlData(folder_arr_data, folder_arr_data.GetType) End If Return (result) End Function

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.EmailFormFieldData(Ektron.Cms.FormData,System.String)

The form data submitted in XML format. Value Type: (System.String)

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.GetContentRatingStatistics(System.Int64,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Returns a collection with keys as ordinal numbers and frequency as the value. That is, {1=>3,2=>7,...,9=>12}. Rating results are bounded by startDate and endDate.
This function is overloaded. See Also:
GetContentRatingStatistics(Integer Integer String)
member.param: The numeric ID associated with the content block being rated.
Bounds the result set by only ratings that occurred after this date.
Bounds the result set by only ratings that occurred before this date.
member.returns: Returns a collection of data with keys "total" => number of ratings, "sum" => sum of all ratings, "r1, "r2", "r3", "r4", "r5", "r6", "r7", "r8", "r9".
member.remarks: Note that average rating = sum/total.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.GetContentRatingStatistics(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.String)
member.summary:
Returns a collection with keys as ordinal numbers and frequency as the value. That is, {1=>3,2=>7,...,9=>12}. Rating results are bounded by startDate and endDate.
This function is overloaded. See Also:
GetContentRatingStatistics(Integer DateTime DateTime)
member.param: The numeric ID associated with the content block being rated.
member.returns: Returns a collection of data with keys "total" => number of ratings, "sum" => sum of all ratings, "r1, "r2", "r3", "r4", "r5", "r6", "r7", "r8", "r9".
member.remarks: Note that average rating = sum/total.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.PurgeContentRatings(System.Int64,System.DateTime,System.DateTime)
member.summary: Purges all ratings of a particular content block over a defined date/time range.
member.param: The ID of the content that is having its ratings purged.
The beginning of the date range of content to be purged.
The end of the date range of content to be purged.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.ecmContentRating(System.Int64,System.Web.UI.Page,System.String,Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels,Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.RatingGraphDisplayType,Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.RatingGraphDisplayType,System.Int32,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Constructs a string that represents a content rating element on a web site. This is composed of a rating dialog and a graph representing current ratings. Note that the content rating server control wraps this functionality.
member.param: The numeric ID associated with the content block being rated.
A reference to the System.Web.UI.Page object representing the active web page.
Specifies a unique ID of this element. No two content rating controls on the same page should specify the same key.
Specifies the labels of the control to be displayed. See Ektron.Cms.ContentRatingLabels
Specifies to show the initial (non-rated) graph to be horizontal to the control, below it, or not at all.
Specifies to show the complete (rated) graph to be horizontal to the control, below it, or not at all.
Specifies the number of pixels between the rating control and the graph.
Specifies the background color of the graph.
Specifies the bar color of the graph.
Specifies the text color of the graph.
member.returns: Returns a string representing the final control.
member.remarks: Note that the ContentRating server control nicely wraps this function.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.BlogObject(System.Int64,System.DateTime)
member.summary:
Overloaded Method to obtain a BlogData Class. Accepts the integer ID of the blog, as well as the StartDate (as DateTime) for the posts. Returns either a populated BlogData class or null (nothing).
This function is overloaded. See Also:
BlogObject(Integer)
BlogObject(Integer DateTime Integer Integer)
BlogObject(FolderData)
member.param: Integer ID of the blog. This corresponds to the id of the blog folder.
The DateTime value to get posts from. You can obtain historical posts with this property, or leave it blank to begin now.
member.returns: Either a populated BlogData class or null (nothing).

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.BlogObject(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Overloaded Method to obtain a BlogData Class. Accepts the integer ID of the blog. Returns either a populated BlogData class or null (nothing).
This function is overloaded. See Also:
BlogObject(Integer DateTime)
BlogObject(Integer DateTime Integer Integer)
BlogObject(FolderData)
member.param: Integer ID of the blog. This corresponds to the id of the blog folder.
member.returns: Either a populated BlogData class or null (nothing).

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.BlogObject(System.Int64,System.DateTime,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Overloaded Method to obtain a BlogData Class. Accepts the integer ID of the blog, the StartDate (as DateTime) for the posts, the number of posts visible and the language ID. Returns either a populated BlogData class or null (nothing).
This function is overloaded. See Also:
BlogObject(Integer)
BlogObject(Integer DateTime)
BlogObject(FolderData)
member.param: Integer ID of the blog. This corresponds to the id of the blog folder.
The DateTime value to get posts from. You can obtain historical posts with this property, or leave it blank to begin now.
member.returns: Either a populated BlogData class or null (nothing).
member.param: Integer number of posts to return. Leave as 0 to use the blog setting, or -1 to return none.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.ContentAPI.BlogObject(Ektron.Cms.FolderData)
member.summary:
Returns the corresponding blog (if applicable) for a complete folderData object. If there is code that already leverages our FolderData class, this can piggyback atop it. Returns only if the folder is a blog.
This function is overloaded. See Also:
BlogObject(Integer DateTime)
BlogObject(Integer DateTime Integer Integer)
BlogObject(Integer)
member.returns: A populated BlogData class or nothing

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CommonApi.ecmLogin(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.AutoAddUserTypes)
member.summary: Returns the login script.
member.param:
This changes the Login button so only membership users can log in. This prevents someone from trying to login as an Ektron CMS400.NET user and gain access to the Ektron CMS400.NET Workarea. The default is False.
True = Allow only membership users to login.
False = Allow Ektron CMS400.NET users and membership users to login.

Hides the Help button that appears below the Login button when set to true. The default is False.
True = Do not display the Help button.
<image login button/>
False = Display Help button.
<image login and help buttons/>

When set to true, users are automatically logged in using Active Directory authentication. Users do not need to enter a username or password. The default is False.
True = Use Active Directory authentication when logging in.
False = Do not use Active Directory authentication when logging in.
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source file
CMS400Demo\\Workarea\\PLATFORMS\\ASP\\test.asp.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CommonApi.LoadBlogRoll(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Loads a blog roll for a given ID. This blog roll is the list of links for the blog. See the BlogRoll class for the properties and usage of the blog roll.
This is an overloaded method. See Also: LoadBlogRoll (String)
member.param: The ID of the blog. This is an integer value that corresponds to the folder ID for the blog.
member.returns: This method returns a populated BlogRoll class or null (nothing).
member.remarks: When using, developers are advised to check for null prior to using.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CommonApi.LoadBlogRoll(System.String)
member.summary:
Loads a blog roll for a given path. The path is a string of the blog path, ex: "\\Media\\Blogs\\MyBlog". This blog roll is the list of links for the blog. See the BlogRoll class for the properties and usage of the blog roll.
This is an overloaded method. See Also: LoadBlogRoll (Integer)
member.param: The path of the blog. This is a string value that corresponds to the folder path of the blog.
member.returns: This method returns a populated BlogRoll class or null (nothing).
member.remarks: When using, developers are advised to check for null prior to using.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CommonApi.LoadBlog(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a BlogData class for a given path, with parameters. This class contains the content for a blog, the post info, the roll, and the categories information. See the BlogData class for more information.
member.param: The path of the blog. This is a string value that corresponds to the folder path of the blog.
The date to get entries from. Used if you want to get historical information.

The total number of posts to return. This is an integer value.
If set to 0, the postsvisible property of the blog is used.
If set to -1, the content is not returned, only the post info for the content.
The language ID for the content to get. An integer value.
member.returns: For a given path, this returns either null or a BlogData class with the associated posts. This also includes the roll, categories, and post information.
member.remarks: Developers are advised to check for null prior to using.

member.name: P:Ektron.Cms.CommonApi.UserLanguage
member.summary: Returns a user's language (used for locale).
member.example:
An example of using this property can be found in the Workarea source file
CMS400Demo\\Workarea\\login.aspx.vb. Here is a code snippet from that page.
Private Sub LogoutUser() If (Not (IsPostBack())) Then Dim language_data As LanguageData Dim m_refSiteApi As New SiteAPI language_data = m_refSiteApi.GetLanguageById(m_refSiteApi.UserLanguage) logoutmsg.InnerHtml = m_refMsg.GetMessage("Logout message") LogoutBtn.Src = language_data.ImagePath & LogoutBtn.Src LogoutPanel.Visible = True Else Dim strCloser As New System.Text.StringBuilder ' Render script to close the Workarea: strCloser.Append("<SCRIPT language='javascript'>" & vbCrLf) strCloser.Append("PopUpWindow('close.aspx?logout=true','Admin400',0,0,0,0);</SCRIPT>" & vbCrLf) strCloser.Append("</SCRIPT>" & vbCrLf) WorkareaCloserJS.Text = strCloser.ToString() End If End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CommonApi.XSLTransform(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Xml.Xsl.XsltArgumentList,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Transforms a given XML document with a given XSLT document. The documents may be either strings or URLs to a file. Specify which using the XsltAsFile and XmlAsFile parameters.
member.param: The XML document to be transformed. The document may be either a string or a URL to a file. Specify which using the XmlAsFile parameter. Value Type: (System.String)
The XSLT document to transform. The document may be either a string or a URL to a file. Specify which using the XsltAsFile parameter. Value Type: (System.String)
Specifies whether XsltDoc is a string or URL. Value Type: (System.Boolean)
Specifies whether XmlDoc is a string or URL. Value Type: (System.Boolean)

Optional arguments to be applied to the transform. Value Type: (System.Xml.Xsl.XsltArgumentList) Additionally, the following arguments are supplied: baseURL - The protocol and host and port, if non-standard, e.g., http://www.example.com LangType - The locale ID of the selected content language, e.g., 1033 for 'English (US)' userId - The ID of the current user, e.g., 1 for 'admin'
Specifies whether errors encountered while processing the documents should be returned as an error message (if true) or whether an exception should be thrown (if false). Value Type: (System.Boolean)
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source file
CMS400Demo\\Workarea\\cmsformsreport.aspx.vb.
member.remarks: If no XsltDoc is provided, the XmlDoc will be returned. If no XmlDoc is provided, the XSLT will be run on an empty XML document with just a root element.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CommonApi.IsARoleMemberForFolder(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether a Role Member is allowed to work with a given folder as an administrator or not. Administrations privileges are for the given folder only. Roles provide the ability to offload/delegate some of the administrator's tasks onto other users, without giving full administration privileges to a user.
member.param: The numeric folder ID for which you are giving the Role Member privileges.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.CommonApi.IsARoleMemberForContent(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether a Role Member is allowed to work with a given piece of content as an administrator or not. Administrations privileges are for the given piece of content only. Roles provide the ability to offload/delegate some of the administrator's tasks onto other users, without giving full administration privileges to a user.
member.param: The numeric content ID for which you are giving the Role Member privileges.

members.member: The CustomRolePermissions are for developers who want to implement the idea of roles into their own code. The two primary functions that will be used are GetRolePermissionSystem and GetRolePermissionFolder, to determine if the current user is a member of the designated system-wide or folder specific (repectievly) custom role. These can be maintained in the CMS settings section, under roles - Custom-Permissions, as well as by using the following funtions.

member.summary: Resets the cookie value.
member.example:
An example of using this function can be found in the Workarea source file
CMS400Demo\\Workarea\\preview.aspx.vb.
Here is a code snippet from that page.
Private Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles MyBase.Load Dim m_refAPI As New CommonApi Try If (m_refAPI.GetCookieValue("site_preview") = 1) Then m_refAPI.SetCookieValue("site_preview", 0) Else m_refAPI.SetCookieValue("site_preview", 1) End If Catch ex As Exception Finally m_refAPI = Nothing End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.User.User.AddNewUser(Ektron.Cms.UserData)

This method is obsolete. Please use the AddMembershipUser method.
Adds a new membership user to CMS.
member.param: An object of class which represents the corresponding user elements.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.User.User.AddMembershipUser(Ektron.Cms.UserData)
member.summary: Adds a new membership user to CMS.
member.param: An object of class which represents the corresponding user elements.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page from which a new membership user can be added. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the AddMembershipUser method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to add the Membership User. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Between the form tags, create a table with four rows and three columns. 2. In the first row, first column, add a label that shows where to enter the membership user's Email address. 3. In the first row, second column, add a text box to enter the Email address. 4. In the first row, third column, add a RequiredFieldValidator control from the Validation control menu. This validates that something appears in the Email address box. Please enter email address 5. In the same table cell, add a RegularExpressionValidator control. This validates the information entered is in the format of an Email address. 6. In the second row, first column, add a label to show where to enter a first name. 7. In the second row, second column, add a text box to enter the fist name. 8. In the second row, third column, add a RequiredFieldValidator control from the Validation control menu. This validates that something appears in the first name box. Please enter first name 9. In the third row, first column, add a label to show where to enter a last name. 10. In the third row, second column, add a text box to enter the last name. 11. In the third row, third column, add a RequiredFieldValidator control from the Validation control menu. This validates that something appears in the last name box. Please enter last name 12. In the fourth row, first column, add a label to show where to enter a password. 13. In the fourth row, second column, add a text box to enter the password. 14. In the fourth row, third column, add a RequiredFieldValidator control from the Validation control menu. This validates that something appears in the password box. Please enter password 15. After the table, add a break and then add a button to submit the membership user's information.
16. Add two breaks for spacing purposes.

17. Add a results label to display a message stating the membership user was added and the new ID. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add button click event. Protected Sub btnAdd_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnAdd.Click 2. Create an object for the user data items. Dim memDetails As New Ektron.Cms.UserData 3. Create an object for the new membership user information. Dim newMemUser As New Ektron.Cms.UserData 4. Create an object for the User API. Dim userAPI As New Ektron.Cms.API.User.User 5. Create an integer place holder for the new ID. Dim newMemUserId As Integer 6. Populate memDetails with the information from the text boxes. memDetails.Username = txtEmail.Text memDetails.FirstName = txtFirstName.Text memDetails.LastName = txtLastName.Text memDetails.Password = txtPassword.Text 7. Create a Try/Catch around the AddMembershipUser method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. Try newMemUser = userAPI.AddMembershipUser(memDetails) 8. Assign newMemUserId a new ID. newMemUserId = newMemUser.Id 9. Check to see if there is an ID returned. If so, display a message with the membership username and ID. If (newMemUserId > 0) Then lblResult.Text = "The membership user " & txtEmail.Text & " was added into CMS400.Net with UserID = " & newMemUserId End If 10. If there is an error, let the user know what happened. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = ex.Message End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.User.User.GetUserByUsername(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the user details for the given user.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page that retrieves user details for a given username. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the GetUserByUsername method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to retrieve the user details. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Between the form tags, add a label to show where to enter a username. 2. Add a text box to enter the username. 3. add a RequiredFieldValidator control from the Validation control menu. This validates that something appears in the username box. 4. Add two breaks for spacing purposes.

5. Add a button to submit the username. 6. Add two more breaks for spacing purposes.

7. Add a label to display the given user's details. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add button click event. Protected Sub btnGetUser_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnGetUser.Click 2. Create an object for the user API. Dim userAPI As New Ektron.Cms.API.User.User 3. Create an object for the user data. Dim userObj As Ektron.Cms.UserData 4. Create a Try/Catch around the GetUserByUsername method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. Try userObj = userAPI.GetUserByUsername(txtUserName.Text.Trim) 5. Check to make sure the a user ID exists. If userObj.Id = 0 Then lblResult.Text = "Invalid Username" Exit Sub End If 6. Create an integer place holder. Dim i As Integer 7. Check to make sure the attribute list is populated. If Not userObj.AttributeList Is Nothing Then 8. If the list is populated, display the results. lblResult.Text = "" For i = 0 To userObj.AttributeList.Length - 1 Step 1 lblResult.Text &= "" lblResult.Text &= "" lblResult.Text &= "" lblResult.Text &= "" lblResult.Text &= "" Next lblResult.Text &= "
Name Value Type
" & userObj.AttributeList(i).Name & "" & userObj.AttributeList(i).Value & "" & userObj.AttributeList(i).ValueType.ToString() & "
" 9. If nothing is contained in the list, display a message. Else lblResult.Text &= "No custom properties set-up for this user" End If 10. If there is an error, let the user know what happened. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = ex.Message End Try End Sub

member.summary: This method allows you to log a user into a server by passing their username and password.

member.summary: This method allows you to log a user into a server by passing their username, password, and server name.
member.param: The system server name. When using Active Directory, this parameter needs to be an empty string "".

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.User.User.LogInUser(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.AutoAddUserTypes)
member.summary: Used to force log in the user and no password required. Note: When using Active Directory/LDAP, this method will log the user only after first successfull LDAP/AD User Login into CMS. when using Active Directory, the ServerName and Protocol parameters are set to empty strings ("").
member.param: The system server name. When using Active Directory, this parameter needs to be an empty string "".
The user's domain, required only when users login using Active Directory. If your domain is intra.example.com, it is entered in the following format: "DC=intra,DC=example,DC=com".
Required only when using a secure login or when you are using any valid Active Directory protocols.
member.remarks: Using this method may increase security risk

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.User.User.LogInUser(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: This method allows you to log a user into a server by passing their username, password, and server name. You can also log in an Active Directory user by providing the username, password and domain. Note: When when using Active Directory, the ServerName and Protocol parameters are set to empty strings ("").
member.param: The system server name. When using Active Directory, this parameter needs to be an empty string "".
The user's domain, required only when users login using Active Directory. If your domain is intra.example.com, it is entered in the following format: "DC=intra,DC=example,DC=com".
This property is always set to an empty string "". This parameter is only required when using Active Directory.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page that programmatically logs a user into CMS400.NET. Please note that the code-behind in this example does not login a new user if someone is already logged into the Workarea. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the LogInUser method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to log the user into CMS400.NET. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Between the form tags, add a label to show where the Username is entered. 2. Add a text box to enter the Username. 3. Add a RequiredFieldValidator control from the Validation control menu. This validates that something appears in the Username box. Please enter user name 4. Add two breaks for spacing purposes.

5. Add a label to show where the Password is entered. 6. Add a text box to enter the Password. 7. Add a RequiredFieldValidator control from the Validation control menu. This validates that something appears in the password box. Please enter password 8. Add two breaks for spacing purposes.

9. Add a button to submit the user's login information. We will add a button click event in the code behind. 10. Add two last breaks for spacing purposes.

11. Add a results label to display a message that states whether the user is logged in. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add a page load event that checks to see if a user is logged into CMS400.NET. Protected Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load Dim api As New Ektron.Cms.CommonApi If (api.RequestInformationRef.CallerId > 0) Then lblResult.Text = api.RequestInformationRef.LoggedInUsername & " is logged in." & <"br/>" End If End Sub 2. Add a button click event. Protected Sub btnLogin_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnLogin.Click 3. Create an object for the user API. Dim userAPI As New Ektron.Cms.API.User.User 4. Create an object for the common API. Dim api As New Ektron.Cms.CommonApi 5. Create an object to store the user data. Dim userObj As UserData 6. Create a Try/Catch around the LogInUser method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. 7. Check to see if the user is already logged in. Try If (api.RequestInformationRef.CallerId > 0) Then lblResult.Text = api.RequestInformationRef.LoggedInUsername & " is already logged in." 8. If the user is not logged in, proceed with the login. Else userObj = userAPI.LogInUser(txtUserName.Text.Trim, txtPassword.Text.Trim, "localhost", "", "") 9. Check to see whether the login was successful. If it was unsuccessful, display a message. If userObj.Id = 0 Then lblResult.Text = "Login failed." Exit Sub End If 10. Set the authentication cookie and Response.Redirect. userAPI.SetAuthenticationCookie(userObj) Response.Redirect(Request.Url.ToString) End If 11. If there is an error, let the user know what happened. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = ex.Message End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Content.Taxonomy.CloneTaxonomy(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Copy or move a group of taxonomy categories from one taxonomy to another. For example, you want move categories one, two and three from taxonomy A to taxonomy B. Copying or moving a taxonomy category depends on whether the DeleteSource parameter is set True or False. If DeleteSouce is set to True, the taxonomy category is deleted. You can specify how many node levels are included by setting the Depth parameter. You can also choose whether to move/copy items in the category or just clone the category's structure.
member.param: The ID of the source category being moved or copied.
The target ID where the category will be moved or copied.

Specify an integer that represents the amount of category sub levels to be copied or moved. For example, if you want to copy two category levels below the source category, enter 2.
To copy or move all sub categories enter -1.
Enter True to copy or move all items from the source structure. If you enter false, copy/move only the taxonomy category's structure.
Enter True to move the source category. This deletes the source category after the node is cloned. Set to false to copy the source category. This leaves the original category in its structure.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.SiteMap.GetWebsiteMap(System.Int64,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates the site map from folder breadcrumb.
member.param: Build the web sitemap from the folder specified.

Do you want to retrieve all nodes at the same level as the one you specify?
True = include all sites at the same level as the folderId property.
False = Do not include the same level nodes.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page that displays the site map for a given folder. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the GetWebsiteMap method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to access and return the site map information. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Between the form tags, add the following label: 2. Add text box where the folder ID can be entered. 3. From the Validation control menu, add a RequiredFieldValidator control. This validates that something appears in the Folder ID box. 4. Add two breaks for spacing purposes.

5. Add a button to submit the folder ID and retrieve the site map information. We will set the button click event in the code behind. 6. Add two more breaks for spacing purposes.

7. Add a label to display the site map. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add a button click event. Protected Sub btnGet_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnGet.Click 2. Check to make sure the folder ID is numeric. If Not IsNumeric(txtFolderId.Text) Then lblResult.Text = "Invalid Folder ID" Exit Sub End If 3. Create an object for the site map API. Dim sitemapApi As New Ektron.Cms.API.SiteMap 4. Create an object for the map data. Dim mapData As Ektron.Cms.Common.WebsiteMap 5. Create a Try/Catch around the GetWebsiteMap method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. Try mapData = sitemapApi.GetWebsiteMap(CInt(txtFolderId.Text), False) 6. Check to make sure child nodes are returned. If child nodes are returned, display the information. If (Not mapData.childrenNodes Is Nothing) Then lblResult.Text = sitemapApi.RenderWebsiteMap(mapData, "") 7. If no child nodes are returned, display a message. Else lblResult.Text = "No breadcrumb path found" End If 8. Display a message if there is an error. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = ex.Message End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.SiteMap.RenderWebsiteMap(Ektron.Cms.Common.WebsiteMap,System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Create HTML to render on the page.
member.param: Stylesheet class to format the HTML. It must exists in [site]/workarea/csslib/sitemap.css. Leave blank to accept default.
Set the max level of the sitemap. Set it to 0 for unlimited.
Set the starting level of the sitemap. Set it to 0 for start from root.
member.remarks: Supported displayType: ListWithDescription | List | RawXml

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.SiteMap.RenderFolderBreadcrumbHtml(Ektron.Cms.Common.SitemapPath[],System.String,System.Boolean,System.String,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Render folder breadcrumb HTML.
member.param: The items contained in the breadcrumb path. Ektron.Cms.Common.SitemapPath
a special character that separates the items in a breadcrumb trail.

Should the items in the breadcrumb path be Hyperlinked?
True = hyperlink breadcrumb items.
False = breadcrumb items appear as plain text.

Determines the type of window that appears on this Web form when a user clicks an item in the breadcrumb trail. The default is _self. * _Self - opens link in the same window. * _Top - opens link in a parent window. * _Blank - opens link in a new window. * _Parent - opens link in the parent frame.

Do you want the breadcrumb path to display vertically?
True = display the breadcrumb trail vertically.
False = display the breadcrumb trail horizontally.
The current page URL. Usually Request.Url.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Search.SearchManager.Execute(Ektron.Cms.UserSearchCondition)
member.summary: Returns the array of UserData based on the criteria UserSearchCondition.

example.code:
Dim isMemberShip As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition isMemberShip.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isMemberShip.setValue = 1 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with db type isMemberShip.setVariable = users.membership_user
Dim isInEktron As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition isInEktron.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isInEktron.setValue = "03031" 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with dynamic_data_tbl labels type isInEktron.setVariable = "customproperties.zip code"
Dim condition As UserSearchCondition = New UserSearchCondition condition.setType = SearchType.AND condition.AddCondition(isInEktron) condition.AddCondition(isMemberShip)
Dim search As New SearchManager Dim result As userdata() = search.Execute(condition)

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Search.SearchManager.Execute(Ektron.Cms.ContentSearchCondition)
member.summary: Returns the array of ContentData based on the criteria ContentSearchCondition.

example.code:

Dim isInEktron As ContentSearchCondition = New ContentSearchCondition isInEktron.setType = SearchType.EQUAL isInEktron.setValue = "03031" 'The value can be integer,string,date and boolean should be match with dynamic_data_tbl labels type isInEktron.setVariable = "customproperties.zip code"
Dim condition As ContentSearchCondition = New ContentSearchCondition condition.setType = SearchType.AND condition.AddCondition(isInEktron) condition.AddCondition(isMemberShip)
Dim search As New SearchManager Dim result As userdata() = search.Execute(condition)

member.name: T:Ektron.Cms.API.Search.SearchManager
member.summary:
The Search Developer API enables searching a CMS400.NET website programmatically based on custom criteria. The Demo Developers Site, if you chose to install it, has excellent examples of programmatically using the SearchManager. It is installed at http://~YourSite~/CMS400Developer/Developer/Websearch/WebsearchApi.aspx. Examples are in VB and C#.
Here is a list of some of the examples. * Retrieve a document or HTML content that contains the word cms. * Retrieve content that contains research and has a searchable metadata wellness set to Cancer. * Retrieve images that contain RotatingGraphic1 in their title. * Retrieve geo-content from CMS400.Net.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Metadata.AddMetaDataType(Microsoft.VisualBasic.Collection)
member.summary: Adds a new metadata type to the system.
member.param: Metadata items as value key pair.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Metadata.AddMetaDataType(Ektron.Cms.ContentMetaData@)
member.summary: Adds a new metadata type to the system.
member.param: ContentMetadata object containing metadata definition details.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page from which you can add a new metadata definition. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the AddMetaDataType(ByRef metaDataItem As ContentMetaData) method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to add the metadata definition. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Create a table with four rows and three columns. 2. In the first row, first column, add a label that shows where to enter the name of the metadata definition. 3. In the first row, second column, add a text box for the user to enter the metadata definition name. 4. In the first row, third column, add a RequiredFieldValidator control from the Validation control menu. This validates that something appears in the name box. 5. In the second row, first column, add a label that show where to select the type. 6. In the second row, second column, add a drop down list for the metadata tag type. We will populate the drop down list in the code behind. 7. Leave the second row, third column empty. 8. In the thrid row, first column, add a label for the Editable option. 9. In the third row, second column, add a check box to decide whether a user can edit the contents of the metadata when creating or editing the metadata’s content. 10. Leave the third row, third column empty. 11. In the fourth row, first column, add a label for the Display in Ektron Explorer option. 12. In the fourth row, second column, add a check box to decide whether the metadata definition should be displayed in Ektron Explorer. 13. Leave the fourth row, third column empty. 14. After the table, add a break and then add a button to add the Metadata Definition.
15. Add two breaks for spacing purposes.

16. Add a results label to display whether the Metadata Definition was added and if so, its ID. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add a page load event. Protected Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load 2. In the page load event, populate the drop down list with the available metadata definition types. These are the only types available. Make sure you add the numeric value. This corresponds to metadata definition type in the database. If (Not IsPostBack()) Then ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("Searchable Property", "100")) ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("Meta Tag", "1")) ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("HTML Tag", "0")) ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("Collection Selector", "2")) ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("Content Selector", "4")) ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("File Selector", "7")) ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("Hyperlink Selector", "6")) ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("Image Selector", "5")) ddlMetaTagType.Items.Add(New ListItem("ListSummary Selector", "3")) End If End Sub 3. Add a button click event. Protected Sub btnAdd_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnAdd.Click 4. Create the following objects. Dim metaDataApi As New Ektron.Cms.API.Metadata Dim metaItem As New Ektron.Cms.ContentMetaData 5. Assign the following metaItem properties. metaItem.TypeName = txtMetaName.Text metaItem.Editable = chkEditable.Checked metaItem.MetaDisplayEE = chkDisplayEE.Checked metaItem.TagType = ddlMetaTagType.SelectedItem.Value 6. Create a Try/Catch around the AddMetaDataType method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. Try metaDataApi.AddMetaDataType(metaItem) 7. Check to make sure a valid TypeID was returned. If so, display the a message and the ID of the newly created metadata definition. If metaItem.TypeId <> 0 Then lblResult.Text = "The above metadata type definition was created in CMS400.NET with ID = " & metaItem.TypeId End If 8. If there is an error, let the user know what happened. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = ex.Message End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Metadata.GetContentMetadataList(System.Int64)
member.summary: Loads all of the metadata for the given content.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page from which all metadata for a specific content ID can be retrieved. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the GetContentMetadataList(ByVal ContentId as Long) method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to retrieve the metadata for the content ID. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Between the form tags, add the following label. 2. Add a text box to enter the content's ID. 3. From the Validation control menu, add a RequiredFieldValidator control. This validates that something appears in the Content ID box. 4. Add two breaks for spacing purposes.

5. Add a button to get the metadata. We will set the button click event in the code behind. 6. Add two more breaks for spacing purposes.

7. Add a label to display to display the metadata information. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add a button click event. Protected Sub btnGetMetaData_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnGetMetaData.Click 2. Create the following objects for the Metadata API, Custom Attribute List and each Custom Attribute item. Dim metaDataApi As New Ektron.Cms.API.Metadata Dim metaDataList As New Ektron.Cms.CustomAttributeList Dim metaItem As New Ektron.Cms.CustomAttribute 3. Check to make sure the content ID is numeric. If Not IsNumeric(txtContentId.Text) Then lblResult.Text = "Invalid Content ID" Exit Sub End If 4. Create a Try/Catch around the GetContentMetadataList method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. Try metaDataList = metaDataApi.GetContentMetadataList(CInt(txtContentId.Text)) 5. Verify that items are returned and create a table to display the returned information. If metaDataList.AttributeList.Length > 0 Then lblResult.Text = " " 6. Populate the table with metadata information and display it. For Each metaItem In metaDataList.AttributeList If metaItem.Value.ToString().Length > 0 Then lblResult.Text &= "" lblResult.Text &= "" lblResult.Text &= "" lblResult.Text &= "" End If Next lblResult.Text &= "
Metaname Value
" & metaItem.Name & "" & metaItem.Value & "
" 8. If no metadata exists, display that information. Else lblResult.Text = "No metadata definitions found" Exit Sub End If 9. Display a message if there is an error. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = ex.Message End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.GetInterchangeFile(System.Int64)

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.GetInterchangeFiles(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a list of interchange files (i.e., XLIFF files) associated with a given content item (i.e., XLIFF Skeleton).
member.param: Specifies the content item (i.e., XLIFF skeleton).
member.remarks: When exporting, XLIFF files for each target language are generated from a skeleton. When importing, an XLIFF file is associated with the skeleton content item it was generated from (the original language) and a new skeleton content item generated by merging the XLIFF with the original skeleton to produce a skeleton in the target language. A skeleton consists of the content, typically the main HTML content block, a summary (HTML), title, meta data, etc.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.GetInterchangeFilesInZipFile(System.Int64)
member.summary: Returns a list of interchange files (i.e., XLIFF files) contained within a given ZIP file.
member.remarks: XLIFF is a standard to interchange localization information for translation of text. The XLIFF files are compressed together into one or more ZIP files for convenience.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.GetJobs
member.summary:
Returns a list of the top-level jobs, export and import jobs. The jobs listed depend on the user id, unauthenticated users (e.g., translators) see only publicly available jobs (e.g., ZIP files for download). Administrators can view all jobs, non-administrators may only view jobs they created.
This function is overloaded. See Also: GetJobs (Long)

\Returns a list of the sub jobs of the given job.
This function is overloaded. See Also:

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.GetTranslationUploadDirectory
member.summary:
\Returns the server directory path to upload XLIFF and ZIP files for importing. For example, C:\\inetpub\\wwwroot\\~SiteRoot~\\workarea\\uploadedfiles\\localization.
\See Also: .
member.returns: The server directory path (as a String) to store XLIFF and ZIP files that are to be imported.
member.remarks: This directory path should not be displayed on a web page.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.StartExportContentForTranslation(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Starts the process of exporting the content specified by ListOfContentIDs. The status of the process may be monitored by visiting localizationjobs.aspx, which uses methods in this class. The translatable text and documents are exported as XLIFF files compressed in ZIP files. The XLIFF files are suitable for sending to a translator. Once translated, the XLIFF files should be imported using the method.
member.param: Comma\-delimited list of content IDs. e.g., "11,12"
Comma\-delimited list of language IDs. e.g., "1031,1036"
member.remarks: To export all content in a folder, use StartExportFolderForTranslation (Long Integer Boolean String). See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.StartExportFolderForTranslation(System.Int64,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary: Starts the process of exporting all the content specified by ContentType in the specified folder. Optionally, all the content in the subfolders may be processed as well. The status of the process may be monitored by visiting localizationjobs.aspx, which uses methods in this class. The translatable text and documents are exported as XLIFF files compressed in ZIP files. The XLIFF files are suitable for sending to a translator. Once translated, the XLIFF files should be imported using the .
member.param: Specifies the folder containing the content to export.
Specifies which type or types of content to export.
Specifies whether to export just the specified folder or all subfolders as well.
Comma\-delimited list of language IDs. e.g., "1031,1036"
member.remarks:
To export just selected content, use StartExportFolderForTranslation (Long Integer Boolean String)
See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.StartExportMenusForTranslation(System.String)
member.summary: Starts the process of exporting all menus. The status of the process may be monitored by visiting localizationjobs.aspx, which uses methods in this class. The translatable text is exported as an XLIFF file and compressed in a ZIP file. The XLIFF file is suitable for sending to a translator. Once translated, the XLIFF file should be imported using the method.
member.param: Comma\-delimited list of language IDs. e.g., "1031,1036"
member.remarks: See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Localization.StartImportTranslation
member.summary: Starts the process of importing XLIFF files that have been translated. The files should be uploaded to server directory specified by . Files may be XLIFF files (.xlf extension) or XLIFF files that are compressed in ZIP (.zip extension) files.
member.remarks: See http://www.xliff.org for more information about XLIFF.

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Library.GetAllChildLibItems(System.String,System.Int64,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32@)
member.summary:
Loads all of the library items by type. Using the OrderBy parameter allows you to sort the library items. The currentPageNum, pageSize and totalPages parameters are used with paging. Setting currentPageNum and pageSize to zero causes the API To retrieve all items on a single page.
Note: The caller of API must actually call the API with the correct page number to implement paging. The API does not provide any inherent UI for paging purposes.
member.param: The library item's type. (Required) Use one of the following: * images * files * hyperlinks * quicklinks * forms
The order to load the library items. You can pass: * librarytitle * libraryid * libraryfilename * date
The current page number to display.
The page size set by the caller of the API.
The total number of pages required to display all of the items.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page that displays a graphical list of all images stored in the library for a specific folder in the Workarea. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the GetAllChildLibItems method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to retrieve the images. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Between the form tags, add a Label with the following information. 2. Add a text box for the Folder ID. 3. From the Validation control menu, add a RequiredFieldValidator control. This validates that something appears in the Folder ID box. 4. Add a couple of breaks for spacing purposes.

5. Add a submit button. We will set the button click event in the code behind. 6. Add two more breaks for spacing purposes.

7. Add a label to display the list of images. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add a button click event. Protected Sub btnGet_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnGet.Click 2. Check to make sure the folder ID is numeric. If Not IsNumeric(txtFolderId.Text) Then lblResult.Text = "Invalid Folder ID" Exit Sub End If 3. Create an object for the library API. Dim libraryApi As New Ektron.Cms.API.Library 4. Create an array to contain the library data. Dim data As Ektron.Cms.LibraryData() 5. Create a Try/Catch around the GetAllChildLibItems method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. Try data = libraryApi.GetAllChildLibItems("images", CInt(txtFolderId.Text), "", 0, 0, 0) 6. Check to make sure the library has images for the folder. If (Not data Is Nothing) AndAlso (data.Length > 0) Then 7. If so, create an object for each library item. Dim item As Ektron.Cms.LibraryData 8. Create an empty string. Dim str As String = "" 9. Iterate through each item and display the image with the image title as the alt text. For Each item In data str &= "" & "
" & "
" lblResult.Text = str Next 10. If the library contains no images for the folder, display a message. Else lblResult.Text = "No images found" End If 11. Display a message if there is an error. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = ex.Message End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Folder.DeleteFolderById(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Delete the folder by its ID.
See Also: The Example section.
member.returns: False = successfully deleted. Otherwise, returns True.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page from which a folder can be deleted from CMS400.NET by entering its ID. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the DeleteFolderById method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to delete the folder. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Between the form tags, add the following label: 2. Add a text box to enter the folder's ID. 3. From the Validation control menu, add a RequiredFieldValidator control. This validates that something appears in the Folder ID box. 4. Add a couple of breaks for spacing purposes.

5. Add a delete button. We will set the button click event in the code behind. 6. Add two more breaks for spacing purposes.

7. Add a label to let the user know if the delete succeeded. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add a button click event. Protected Sub btnDeleteFolder_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnDeleteFolder.Click 2. Check to make sure the folder ID entered is numeric. If Not IsNumeric(txtFolderId.Text) Then lblResult.Text = "Invalid Folder ID" Exit Sub End If 3. Create an object for the Folder API. Dim folderApi As New Ektron.Cms.API.Folder 4. Create a Try/Catch around the DeleteFolderById method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. Try folderApi.DeleteFolderById(CInt(txtFolderId.Text)) 5. Display whether the deletion was successful. lblResult.Text = "The above folder was deleted from CMS400.NET" 6. If there is an error, let the user know. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = "Error deleting folder" End Try End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Folder.GetChildFolders(System.Int64,System.Boolean,System.String)
member.summary:
Loads all the subfolders for a given folder ID.
See Also: The Example section.
member.param: True = recursive look up. False = none.
member.example:
The following example shows how to create a Web page from which a folder ID can be entered and list of child folders returned. This example uses some standard drag and drop controls and a small section of VB code utilizing the GetChildFolders method. This method uses the InternalAdmin to retrieve the child folder list. In the first section, we will deal with the standard drag and drop controls. In the second, we'll deal with the code behind. 1. Between the form tags, add the following label: 2. Add a text box to enter the folder's ID. 3. From the Validation control menu, add a RequiredFieldValidator control. This validates that something appears in the Folder ID box. 4. Add a couple of breaks for spacing purposes.

5. Add a submit button. We will set the button click event in the code behind. 6. Add two more breaks for spacing purposes.

7. Add a label to display the list of child folder names. Add the following information to the code behind of your aspx.vb page. 1. Add a button click event. Protected Sub btnGetChildFolders_Click(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles btnGetChildFolders.Click 2. Create an object for the Folder API. Dim folderApi As New Ektron.Cms.API.Folder 3. Check to make sure the folder ID is numeric. If Not IsNumeric(txtFolderId.Text) Then lblResult.Text = "Invalid Folder ID" Exit Sub End If 4. Create an object as an array of FolderData. Dim folders As Ektron.Cms.FolderData() 5. Create a Try/Catch around the GetChildFolders method. This allows you to catch any exceptions and helps when debugging. Try folders = folderApi.GetChildFolders(CInt(txtFolderId.Text), True, "name") 6. Use an If/Else statement to display whether child folders exist. If (folders Is Nothing) Then lblResult.Text &= "Child folders: None" 7. If child folders exist, display a total count. Else lblResult.Text &= "Child folders: " & folders.Length.ToString & "
" 8. Iterate through the array and display each child folder's name. Dim i As Integer For i = 0 To folders.Length - 1 Step 1 lblResult.Text &= folders(i).Name & "
" Next End If 9. Display a message if there is an error. Catch ex As Exception lblResult.Text = "Error getting child folders" End Try End Sub 10. Add a page load event so that lblResult.Text is blank when the page first loads. Protected Sub Page_Load(ByVal sender As Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs) Handles Me.Load lblResult.Text = "" End Sub

member.name: M:Ektron.Cms.API.Folder.GetChildFolders(System.Int64,System.Boolean,Ektron.Cms.Common.EkEnumeration.FolderOrderBy)
